parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.51

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game6</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version6</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Groups

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Sets the cowardice level (the lack of courage or bravery) of a group or unit.
<br><br>
Notes:
* The more cowardice a [[Group]] or [[Object]] has, the sooner it will start fleeing.
* 0 means maximum courage, while 1 means always fleeing.
* More details in [[fleeing]]

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> unitOrGroup '''allowFleeing''' cowardice

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitOrGroup: [[Object]] or [[Group]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> cowardice: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_group1 [[allowFleeing]] 0;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[fleeing]]
</value></part></template></root>
